newsitem.title: FRANCE: Air France Europe to start Orly shuttles.
newsitem.headline: Air France Europe to start Orly shuttles.

text.p: Air France Europe said it will launch a new express product with the introduction of the airline's programme of "shuttle" services between Paris-Orly and Marseille, Toulouse and Nice next week.
From October 27, Air France Europe is to operate 27 daily rotations between Paris/Orly and Marseille, 26 to and from Toulouse and 15/16 to and from Nice, using Airbus 320 series passenger aircraft.

At peak periods, flights between Paris/Orly and Marseille and Toulouse will operate every half hour and every hour during off-peak periods. The wholly owned Air France subsidiary was previously Air Inter.

"The new product, named 'Navette' (French for Shuttle) will take advantage of the high volume of flights and offer customers "same day" delivery deadlines for express packages with a maximum unit weight of 30 kilogrammes and up to 500 kilogrammes for consolidated shipments," an Air France Europe cargo official told Reuters.
The door-to-door Navette service will provide morning pick-ups services between 0630 GMT and 0930 GMT at locations within a radius of approximately 20 kilometres from the airports, the official said.
Shipments will then be loaded aboard "shuttle" flights leaving around the lunchtime period and will reach their final destination between 1330-1430 GMT.
Air France Europe's existing door-to-door express product, Lasair, offers half-day deadlines for packages with an average weight of 100 kilos using the airline's network of around 400 daily flights.
The French carrier also offers an airport-to-airport or airport-to-door express service called Airporte. - Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542-7706 Fax+44 171 542-5017
